owl:Ontology.dc:creator: Adolfo Antón Bravo (Ontology Engineering Group - Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
Oscar Corcho (Ontology Engineering Group - Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
owl:Ontology.dc:description: Module of the Transmodel Ontology focused on facilities. This ontology provides support to the NeTEx model. Visit https://github.com/oeg-upm/transmodel-ontology
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Transmodel Ontology - Facilities
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: Module of the Transmodel Ontology focused on facilities. This ontology provides support to the NeTEx model. Visit https://github.com/oeg-upm/transmodel-ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: Transmodel Ontology - Facilities
owl:Ontology.owl:versionInfo: This is the initial version of the module on Facilities, after considering the UML models and XSD descriptions of Transmodel and NeTEx

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property sets the relationship between Site and Entrance
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: accessed by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: Determine whether this should be moved to another module if the concept AccessibilityAssessment is moved as well
This property is used to relate a site element, a facility, etc., with a specific accessibility assessment. In some of the UML models of Transmodel this property is name as characerisedBy
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: accessibility assessment

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: the range of this property may be further restricted to those SKOS concepts that also comply with skos:broader tmkosfacility:FacilityType/AccomodationFacilityType

This property restricts the type of facility to one specific for accommodation from the SKOS codelist for types of facilities, including, for example, values like seating, sleeper, couchette, special seating, reclining seats, standing, etc.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: accommodation facility

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: Check whether this property is also applicable to other things beyond Site Facility Sets
This property relates a Site Facility Set with a Site
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: available at

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: the range of this property may be further restricted to those SKOS concepts that also comply with skos:broader tmkosfacility:FacilityType/BoardingPermissionType
This property describes the types of boarding permissions allowed for an Onboard Stay from the SKOS codelist for types of facilities, including normal, early boarding, late alighting, etc.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: boarding permission

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: General property for all types of containment and aggregation
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: comprises

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: Check carefully whether the range should be Equipment or, instead, something more general like Facility, since the differentiation between Facility and Equipment is sometimes unclear

This property is used to aggregate other types of facilities from a Facility Set, normally focused on those that are user defined and not from the predefined list. In the Transmodel UML model this is represented as TypeOfEquipment, and in the Netex implementation the term otherFacilities is used.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: comprises equipment

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property is used to aggregate all the facilities that a facility set contains In Netex, this is expressed with the element TypeOfFacilityRef, which is used to refer to facilities, and in the Transmodel UML ontology this is simply expressed as 'facility'
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: comprises facility

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property allows connecting any object with a Facility Set
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: concerned by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property allows specifying that a Stop contains Quays
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: containing

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: the range of this property may be further restricted to those SKOS concepts that also comply with skos:broader tmkosfacility:FacilityType/CouchetteFacilityType
This property restricts the type of facility to one specific for couchette from the SKOS codelist for types of facilities, including, for example, values like T2, T3, C1, C2, etc.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: couchette facility

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property sets the relationship between Accessibility Assessment and Accessibility Limitation
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: determining

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The assignment of one ScheduledStopPoint and one JourneyPattern to a PassengerInformationEquipment specifying that information on the ScheduledStopPoint and the JourneyPattern will be provided (e.g. displayed, printed)
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: displayAssignment

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property is used to link an equipment with the types of equipments available in the SKOS concept scheme of types of equipments
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: equipment Type

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: relate it to a more general property for containment and partOf
This property is used to define the equipments that are available in an equipment place
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: equipped With

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A classification of public transport Vehicles according to the facilities available on the Vehicle
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: facilityRequirement

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Set of Facilities available for a ServiceJourney or a JourneyPart. The set may be available only for a specific VehicleType within the service (e.g. carriage equipped with low floor)
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: facilitySet

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property is used to link a facility with the types of facilities available in the SKOS concept scheme of types of facilities
facility type
TODO: create the list of allowed values for fare classes, and check whether including it as a facility type, as included in the TransModel model
This property relates an Onboard Stay or an Accommodation, among others, with a class of fares, whose allowed values are defined in the TransModel Common Facility Values (Figure 290, page 454)
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: fare class

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: find a more general property (probably similar to contains/containedIn) and think about whether it should be replaced by this more general property, or at least created as a subProperty of that one.
This property is used to relate an equipment with the equipment place where it is located
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: located in

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The assignment of a Notice showing an exception in a JourneyPattern, a CommonSection or a VehicleJourney, possibly specifying at which PointInJourneyPattern the validity of the Notice starts and ends respectively
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: noticeAssignment

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property is used to relate an equipment place (a collection of equipments) or a specific place equipment with the different equipment positions that they may have
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: position

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property relates a Service Facility Set with a Vehicle Type, indicating that the set of service facilities comprised by the set are provided at that type of vehicle
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: present at

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: Add org:Organization as range for this property TODO: Check whether the domain should be generalised (applicable not only to facility set but also to facility, site, equipment, etc.)
This property is used to refer to the provider of a facility set In the TransModel UML model and in the Netex implementation this is expressed as ProvidedByRef
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: provided by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: TODO: the range of this property may be further restricted to those SKOS concepts that also comply with skos:broader tmkosfacility:FacilityType/XXX, where XXX refers to the shower facilities

This property restricts the type of facility to one specific for shower from the SKOS codelist for types of facilities. However, there is no specific part of the codelist reserved yet for shower facilities.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: shower facility

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A physical entrance or exit to/from a StopPlace for a Passenger. May be a door, barrier, gate other recognizable point of access
stopPlaceEntrance
TODO: the range of this property may be further restricted to those SKOS concepts that also comply with skos:broader tmkosfacility:FacilityType/XXX, where XXX refers to the toilet facilities

This property restricts the type of facility to one specific for toilets from the SKOS codelist for types of facilities. However, there is no specific part of the codelist reserved yet for toilet facilities (also known as sanitary facilities).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: toilet facility

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Classification of the Entrance Equipment
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: typeOfEntranceEquipment

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: types of handrails
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: typeOfHandrail

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The relationship between the PassengerInformationDesk with the typeOfInformationDesk
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: typeOfPassengerInformationDesk

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This property sets the relationaship between Accessibility Limitation and the kos wheelchair-access
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: wheelchair Access

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: This property relates an Onboard Stay with a duration
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: duration

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: This property is used to determine whether an equipment is fixed in a place or not.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: fixed

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Characteristic of a Service that is free to use it
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: freeToUse

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: This property allows specifying whether the equipment is out of service or not
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: out of service

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of VehicleAccessEquipment dedicated to VehicleAccessAreaDimmension
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: VehicleAccessAreaDimension

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of Place Equipment dedicated to access (e.g. lifts, entrances, stairs, ramps, etc.)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Access Equipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The accessibility characteristics of an Entity (facility) used by Passenger such as a Stop Place or a Stop Place Component. Described by AccessibilityLimitations and/or a set of Suitabilities
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Accessibility Assessment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A categorisation of the accessibility characteristics of a Site, e.g. a Stop Place or a Stop Place Component to indicate its usability by passengers with specific needs, for example, those needing wheelchair access, step-free access or wanting to avoid confined spaces such as lifts. A small number of well-defined categories are used that are chosen to allow the consistent capture of data and the efficient computation of routes for different classes of user.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Accessibility Limitation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This is a subclass of Service Facility Set to refer to types of accommodations, according to the Facility Conceptual Model (figure 287, page 450) of TransModel
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Accommodation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Link where a control process is acivated when a vehicle passes it.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ActivationLink

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Point where a control process is activated when a vehicle passes it. equipment may be needed for activation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ActivationPoint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Assistance Services for dissabled users of the Public Transport Network
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: AssistanceForDissabledUsers

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of LocalService for Assistance providing information like language, accessibility trained staff, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: AssistanceService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
A specialisation of Customer Services for booking services
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: BookingOffice

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of LocalService for CateringService
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CateringService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One specialisation of SiteComponent for Check in services
TODO: Check whether this has to be maintained, as it does not seem to appear clearly in any of the conceptual or implementation models of Transmodel
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CheckIn

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: CommercialService is the specialisation of services for commercial purposes
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained as a classification or only keep them in a flat list, as it is proposed in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CommercialService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of LocalService dedicated to communication services
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CommunicationService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of CustomerService for Complaints Services
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ComplaintsService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A constraint that can take place at a SiteComponent that may potentially incur a time penalty that should be allowed for when journey planning
Constraint
A time penalty associated with a Constraint
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ConstraintDelay

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Access feature for CheckConstraint
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ConstraintOfAccess

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: ConstraintThroughput is the throughput of a Constraint: the number of passenger who can pass through it in a specified interval
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ConstraintThroughput

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Specialisation of PlaceAccessEquipment for CrossingEquipment
- Zebra
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CrossingEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
Generic specialisation of LocalService for CustomerServices (LostProperties, MeetingPoint, Complaiants, etc.)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CustomerService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A specialisation of PlaceEquipment describing cycle parking equipment
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CycleStorageEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: EmergencyService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A specific UserNeed, i.e. a requirement of a Passenger travelling with luggage, animal or any other object requiring special arrangements to access PublicTransport
owl:Class.rdfs:label: EncumbranceNeed

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A physical entrance or exit to/from a Site. May be a door, barrier, gate or other recognizable Point of Access.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Entrance

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceAccessEquipment for Entrances (door, barrier, gate or other recognizable point of access)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: EntranceEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
An equipment that may be located on a Vehicle, Site, etc. There are many different types of equipment, each of which may have specific properties (hence a large classification of concepts is provided as subclasses of this class).
The two main specialisations are Local Service and Installed Equipment.
A Local Service is an intangible service that is provided at a site, such as selling tickets, porterage, etc.
An Installed Equipment is the fixed equipment that may be installed fixed on a site (Place Equipment - e.g., door, lift, gate, etc.) or a vehicle (Vehicle Equipment), or mixed (e.g., rubish bins, sanitary equipment or ticketing equipments).
These are further characterised as Place Equipment (equipment which may be located only on a SITE, such as a barrier, bench, lift) and Passenger Equipment (equipment which may be located on either a Vehicle or a Site, such as a display terminal, ticket validator or WC)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Equipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An Equipment Place is a Site Component containing Equipment
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Equipment Place

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TODO: Add a geolocation property for the position (most probably it will be a GeoSPARQL property, or a relationship to geo:Point)
The position that an equipment has, which comes with geospatial information and a description
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Equipment Position

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of StairEquipment for Escalator Equipment
owl:Class.rdfs:label: EscalatorEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A named amenity available to the public at a Site or on a Service.
A Facility has a type that determines the type of facility that it refers to, available in the SKOS codelist https://w3id.org/transmodel/kos/facilities/facilityType (in Netex this is represented as a set of enumerations)
A Facility has no further properties than a name. An Equipment or LocalService is used to describe the further properties provided as part of a particular Facility
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Facility

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A facility set is an aggregation of facilities. In Netex this is represented as a set of enumerated facility values (names based on TPEG classifications, augmented with UIC etc.). The terms used for relating a facility set to the facilities and equipment are CommonFacilityGroup and otherFacilities. We have preferred using comprisesFacility and comprisesEquipment to simplify the terminology that is being used.
TODO: Add a restriction in subclassof for :providedBy only org:Organization
TODO: Transmodel also identifies as a potential restriction the assignment of 0 to N validity conditions to the Facility Set, but this has not been yet modelled
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Facility Set

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A specialisation of the Stop Place describing a stop of a Flexible Service. It may be composed of Flexible Areas or Hail and Ride Areas identifying the catchment areas for flexible services (when they use areas or flexible quays). Some Flexible Places also use regular Stop Places for their stops. When assigned to a Scheduled Stop Point the corresponding Scheduled Stop Point is supposed to be a Zone (the centroid point of the Zone being the Scheduled Stop Point).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Flexible Stop Place

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A private WiFi network that is available under certain characteristics
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: FreeWifi

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Facility of PlaceEquipment used for parking and maintaining vehicles. Parking Point in a Garage are called GaragePoint.
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Garage

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of SignEquipment for headings providing information like direction name, line name, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: HeadingSign

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: HiringService is the specialisation of CommercialService for hiring services
owl:Class.rdfs:label: HiringService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One specialisation of SiteComponent for Migration affaires
TODO: Check whether this has to be maintained, as it does not seem to appear clearly in any of the conceptual or implementation models of Transmodel
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Immigration

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Information Booklet is public transport piece of Equipment dedicated to inform
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: InformationBooklet

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A public transport information piece of Equipment
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: InformationLeaflet

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An Installed Equipment is a fixed equipment that may be installed on a site (such as a door, lift, gate, etc.) or a vehicle. Its exact location may be specified by an Equipment Place. Physical equipments installed either fixed (PlaceEquipment), on-board (VehicleEquipment) or mixed (some equipments as rubish, sanitary or ticketing).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Installed Equipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: LeftLuggageService is the implementation of LuggageService for LeftLuggageService
owl:Class.rdfs:label: LeftLuggageService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceAccessEquipment dedicated to PlaceAccessLift
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PlaceAccessLift

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A Service (LocalService such as LeftLuggage, TicketingService) is considered as immaterial Equipment as well.
A named Service relating to the use of the Site or transport Services at a particular location, for example Porterage, AssistanceForDissabledUsers, BookingOffices, etc. The Service may have a validityCondition associated with it.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Service

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of CustomerService for LostProperties
owl:Class.rdfs:label: LostProperties

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of VehicleAccessEquipment dedicated to LowFloor
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: LowFloor

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of LuggageLockerEquipment for StopPlaceEquipment
owl:Class.rdfs:label: LuggageLockerEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Specialisation of CustomerServices for LuggageServices.
Provides facilities as LuggageTrolley, FreeToUse, etc.
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained or moved to LocalService, as it is present elsehwere in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: LuggageService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: LuggageTrolley
Specialisation of LuggageServices for LuggageTrolleyServices

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of CustomerService for meeting points (provides characteristics like description, labels...)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: MeetingPointService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: MoneyService is the specialisation of Commercial services for money services. Provides information about money services.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: MoneyService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A text for informational purposes on exceptions in a Line, a Journey Pattern, etc. The information may be usable for Passenger or driver information
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Notice

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This is a type of Service Facility Set, according to the Facility Conceptual Model (figure 287, page 450) of TransModel
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Onboard Stay

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of SignEquipment which are not HeadingSign nor PlaceSign
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Other Sign

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Person who uses Public Transport Services
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Passenger

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A Passenger Area within a StopPlace such as: - Concourse - Booking Hall - Immigration Hall - Security Area
Accessible by Passenger but without direct access to Vehicles
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PassengerArea

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An item of equipment of a particular type actually available at a location within a Place (fixed) or a Vehicle (onboard)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PassengerEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A public transport information piece of Equipment, as for instance terminals (on street, at information desks, telematic,...) or printed material (leaflets displayed at Stops, booklets, ...)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PassengerInformationEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A public transport information piece of Equipment which is printed material (leaflets displayed at Stops, booklets, ...)
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PassengerInformationPrintedMaterial

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A public transport information piece of equipment such as street stands, information desks or telematic services
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PassengerInformationDesk

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An item of Equipment of a particular type actually available at a location within a Place. It can only have one position
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PlaceEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Place Lighting
SignEquipment withe the name of a Place on it
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PlaceSign

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Porterage
PorterageService
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
A PostOfficeService is the specialisation of CommunicationService for post mail services
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PostOfficeService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A place such as platform, stance, or quayside where passengers have access to public transport vehicles, taxi, cars or other means of transportation. A Quay may serve one or more Vehicle Stopping Places and be associated with one or more Scheduled Stop Points.
A Quay may contain other sub Quays
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Quay

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of VehicleAccessEquipment dedicated to VehicleRamp
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: VehicleRamp

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceEquipment dedicated to access
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PlaceAccessRamp

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of LocalService dedicated to retail services
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RetailService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of Passenger Equipment for Rubish Disposal
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RubishDisposal

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of Passenger Equipment for Sanitary Equipment
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TypeOfSanitaryEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One specialisation of SiteComponent for Security Screening
TODO: Check whether this has to be maintained, as it does not seem to appear clearly in any of the conceptual or implementation models of Transmodel
owl:Class.rdfs:label: SecurityScreening

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A service facility set contains a set of facilities available for a service journey or a journey part. The set may be availabe only for a specific vehicle type within the service (e.g., carriage equipped with low floor). It can also include information about the accommodation on board, which can be related to the Accommodation or OnboardStay concepts, which are subclasses of Facility, via the comprisesFacility object property. These two concepts are further refined since they may have additional attributes beyond the indication of the corresponding SKOS concepts, as in the other cases.
TODO: Other class restrictions that may be added may include: - for (inverse of made using), for Vehicle Journey and Coupled Journey (see figure 287, Facility conceptual Model)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Service Facility Set

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A building or other structure constructed at a Bus Stop
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Shelter

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of SanitaryEquipment for showers
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Shower

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceEquipment for Signs
owl:Class.rdfs:label: SignEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A well known Place to which Passengers may refer to indicate the origin or a destination of a Trip
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Site

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An element of a Site describing a part of its structure. Site Components share common properties for data management, accessibility and other features
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Site Component

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A place

TODO: Although the Transmodel conceptual model on Site Equipment specifies that a Site Element can only have one accessibility assessment, this may need to be relaxed to allow for more values to be included.
TODO: Check whether this should be related to a more general concept defining a place
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Site Element

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceEquipment for Site
owl:Class.rdfs:label: SiteEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A site facility set contains a set of facilities available at a site
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Site Facility Set

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceAccessStair for StairCaseEquipment
owl:Class.rdfs:label: StairCaseEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceAccessEquipment dedicated to PlaceAccessStair (stair, escalator, staircase, etc.)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PlaceAccessStair

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A place comprising one or more locations where Vehicles may stop and where passengers may board or leave Vehicles or prepare their Trip. A Stop Place will usually have one or more well-known names.
TODO: Add Stop Place Components to the Stop Place, if considered useful.
TODO: Add Stop Place Type as a SKOS Concept Scheme, and connect it to such concept scheme via an object property

TODO: If considered relevant, add connections from this class to the classes Point of Interest (this stop place services such Point of Interest) and to the class StopPlaceVehicleEntrance (this stop place is entered through an entrance - typical in an interchange area).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Stop Place

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An element of a StopPlace describing part of its structure. StopPlaceComponent share common properties for data management, accessibility and other features
owl:Class.rdfs:label: StopPlaceComponent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A physical Entrance or Exit to/from a Stop Place for a Passenger. May be a door, barrier, gate or other recognizable point of access.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Stop Place Entrance

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A physical area within a StopPlace, for example, a Quay, BoardingPosition, AccessSpace or EquipmentPlace
owl:Class.rdfs:label: StopPlaceSpace

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A statement of whether a particular UserNeed can be met. It can be used to state whether a Site can accessed by a Passenger with a particular UserNeed.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Suitability

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One specialisation of SiteComponent for Ticket control
TODO: Check whether this has to be maintained, as it does not seem to appear clearly in any of the conceptual or implementation models of Transmodel
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TicketControl

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of Passenger Equipment for Ticket Validator Equipment
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TicketValidatorEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of Passenter Equipment for Ticketing Equipment
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TicketingEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Toilet

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of StopPlaceEquipment for trolley stands
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TrolleyStandEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A users's need for a particular Suitability
owl:Class.rdfs:label: UserNeed

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Condition used in order to characterise a given Version of a VersionFrame. A ValidityCondition consists of a parameter (e.g. date, triggering event, etc.) and its type of application (e.g. for, from, until, etc.)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ValidityCondition

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A user defined ValidityCondition used by a rule for selecting versions. E.g. river level > 1.5 m. and bad weather
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ValidityRuleParameter

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: External event defining a ValidityCondition. T. g. exceptional flow of a river, bad weather, road closure for works
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ValidityTrigger

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A PublicTransportVehicle used for carrying Passenger
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Vehicle

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of VehicleEquipment dedicated to access Vehicles providing information such as low floor, ramp, access area dimensions, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: VehicleAccessEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceEquipment for Vehicle charging
owl:Class.rdfs:label: VehicleChargingEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PassengerInformationOnBoard

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A fixed equipment installed on a vehice. In Transmodel, this concept is called Actual Vehicle Equipment
TODO: check whether the range of the property locatedIn should go into the concept Vehicle from a different module of the ontology
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Vehicle Equipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A classification of Public Transport Vehicles of the same Vehicle Type, e.g. according to Equipment specifications or model generation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: VehicleModel

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A place on the vehicle track where vehicles stop in order for passengers to board or alight from a vehicle.
A vehicle track is located on the respective infrastructure link for the mode (railway element of railway network, road element of road network, etc.).
A vehicle stopping place may be served by one or more quays.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Vehicle Stopping Place

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A classification of public transport vehicles according to the vehicle scheduling requirements in mode and capacity
owl:Class.rdfs:label: VehicleType

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of StopPlaceEquipment for WaitingEquipment (shelter, waiting room, etc.)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: WaitingEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Waiting Room
Specialisation of WaitingEquipment for WaitingRoom, classified by TypeOfWaitingRoom
owl:Class.rdfs:label: WaitingRoom
WaitingRoomEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
TODO: Check if this has to be maintained, as it is not present in the Equipment Overview Physical Model of Transmodel (figure 247)
Specialisation of Vehicle Equipment for wheel chair accessibility on board a Vehicle providing information suchs as the number of wheelchair areas and the access dimmensions
owl:Class.rdfs:label: WheelchairVehicleEquipment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Point where a beacon or similar device to support the automatic detection of vehicles passing by is located
owl:Class.rdfs:label: BeaconPoint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A ServiceJourney is a Passenger carrying VehicleJourney for one specified DayType. The pattern of working is in principle defined by a ServiceJourneyPattern.
TODO: To remove once that we are sure that we are not breaking anything
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Service

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: A VehicleType composed of a sequence of more than one vehicles of the type Train
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: compoundTrain

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: A public transport information piece of Equipment indoors
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: InformationDesk

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: A public transport information piece of Equipment outdoors
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: informationStand

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceAccessStair Equipment dedicated to PlaceAccessStairEscalator
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: placeAccessStairScalator

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceAccessStair Equipment dedicated to PlaceAccessStairStair
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: placeAccessStairStair

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of PlaceAccessStair Equipment dedicated to PlaceAccessStairStaircase
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: placeAccessStairStaircase

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: A public transport information piece of Equipment online
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: telematicInformationService

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Concept scheme where all the codelists for the types of equipment that are included in the Transmodel ontology are included
Concept scheme where all the codelists for the types of facilities that are included in the Transmodel ontology
List of concepts regarding Mobility Limitation defined in kos/journeys/mobility-limitation
